comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of May 29, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B05E0D8173AE633A... reports on a garden party at Governors Island at which Mrs Garrison and Mrs. Leary were among those receiving the guests. A contiguous photo is definitely of that event. Perhaps one of the Flickr fashionistas can tell us if Mrs. Leary's hat is adorned by green "aigrettes." That's what she wore for the garden party. If not, it might be another event. The article does not mention Mrs. Hammond.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Other Bain/LOC photos from the 1914 version of the Army Relief Society's annual garden party on Governors' Island:

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Richard Arthur Norton, swanq & Wystan:

Thanks once again for the research to pull this group of images together.  I think it's pretty likely this group is at the party on Governor's Island, despite the lack of mention of Mrs. J.H. Hammond in the New York Times article. (And those feathers on Mrs. Leary's do look like they may be aigrettes though it's not easy to tell if they are green, as the article details! Aigrettes were usually egret or white heron plumes, but the term also was used for other similar-looking feathers.)  We will update this record to reflect these new details.
